did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Princess Anne County (Va.) List of Freed Negroes, 1864

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Princess Anne County (Va.) List of Freed Negroes, 1864, Princess Anne County (Va.) Reel 76. Local government records collection, Virginia Beach (City)/Princess Anne County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item was microfilmed by the Library of Virginia's Imaging Services Division.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Princess Anne County was formed in 1691 from Lower Norfolk County. Now extinct, it was incorporated into the city of Virginia Beach in 1963.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Princess Anne County (Va.) List of Freed Negroes, 1864, records the date, full name, age, eye color, hair color, complexion, height, occupation, where from (state and county), present residence, and remarks. Many of the remarks note that the person is a deserter from the "Rebel Army" or has "gone North." Many others are listed as having left Virginia for cities such as St. Louis, Washington, DC, Baltimore, and New York. Many of those listed are originally from counties other than Princess Anne and from states other than Virginia. There is no index.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Princess Anne County Free Negro and Slave Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm" found on the Library of Virginia web site.
